form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: U.S. Department of State X-RAY and Classification Work, DS-2053

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/13/2023 U.S. Department of State OMB No. 1405-0113 EXPIRATION DATE: 1/31/2004 CH X-RAY AND CLASSIFICATION WORKS ET ESTIMATED BURDEN: 45 minutes (See Page 2 Back of Form) For Use with DS-2053 Complete Sections 1 through 5. As Applicable Name (Last, First, MI) Age DEMELUS, LESPERANCE 93 ans Birth Date (mm-dd-yyyy) Passport Number Alien (Case) Number 08-04-1913 HCP11756 2005674119 1. Chest X-Ray Needed (mark all that apply) History of tuberculosis (TB) disease TB signs or symptoms Contact with TB patient Adult (with or without any of the other) (if child does not have any of the above, stop here) 2. Chest X-Ray Finding Date Chest X-Ray taken (mm-dd-yyyy) 01-25-200 r J Normal findings Abnormal findings (indicate findings and interpretation, checking all that apply. and any other in table below Can suggest ACTIVE TB Can suggest INACTIVE TB OTHER X- ray findings (Need smears) (Need smears if symptomatic) Infiltrate or consolidation Discrete fibrotic scar or linear opacity Follow-up needed Any cavitary lesion Discrete nodule(s) without calcification Musculoskeletal Nodule with poorly defined margin Discrete fibrotic scar with volume loss Cardiac (such as tuberculoma) or retraction Pulmonary Pleural effusion Discrete nodule(s) with volume loss or retraction Other Hilar/Mediastinal adenopathy Other (such as bronchiectasis) No follow-up needed needed for Linear, interstitial markings Pleural thickening, diaphragmatic tenting, Other (such as military findings) blunting costophrenic angle, solitary calcified nodule or granuloma or minor musculosketal or cardiac finding Remarks 3. Sputum Smears No, applicant has no signs or symptoms of TB and : X-ray suggests INACTIVE TB, this is a Class B2/TB OTHER X-ray findings suggest follow-up needed after arrival, this is B Other OTHER X-ray findings suggest no follow-up needed, this is No Class X-ray Normal, this is No Class Yes, applicant has (mark all that apply): and smear results are: Positive Negative Dates obtained (mm/dd/yyyy) Signs or symptoms of TB present, See Section 1 X-ray suggests ACTIVE TB, See Section 2 Sputum smear results and X-ray findings: Three smear results NEGATIVE and At least one smear result POSITIVE and X-ray Normal with Signs of symptoms resolved, this is No Class Any Chest X-Ray finding, this is Class A/TB Signs or symptoms suggest follow-up needed after arrival, this is B Other (Normal or Abnormal findings) X-ray suggests ACTIVE or INACTIVE TB, this is Class B1/TB OTHER X-ray findings suggest follow-up needed after arrival, this is Class B other 4. No Class Class A/TB Class B1/TB Class B2/TB Class B Other, follow-up needed 5. Follow-up Needed After Arrival No Yes If Yes, for Not TB condition TB condition Remarks (If yes, specify condition below and on DS-2053; include additional tests, and therapy used with start and stop dates and any changes) DS-3024 Page 1 of 2 01-2001
